concept.title: Index elements
concept.shortdesc: The contents of indexterm elements provides the text for the entries in an index. indexterm elements can be nested to create additional levels of indexing, such as secondary and tertiary index entries.

conbody.p: The following elements contain information that processors can use to generate indexes:

dd.ph: Defines a term that can contribute to an index.
Matching values of start and end attributes on indexterm elements can specify an index range.

dlentry.dd: Defines a term to use as a see reference. See references direct a reader to the preferred term.
Defines a term to use as a see also reference. See also references direct a reader to an alternate index entry for additional information.

conbody.p: How the index elements are combined, the location of indexterm elements, and the hierarchy of the DITA maps all affect how the index elements are processed and the index entries that are generated.
